author: Special Correspondent
text:
Two-wheelers parked on the left side of J.N. Street, after the parking lot was changed from the right side of the road in Puducherry on Friday.— Photo: S.S. Kumar

The Traffic Police have made new parking arrangements from Friday on the arterial Jawaharlal Nehru Street to ensure smooth flow of traffic.

One-side parking

To regulate the traffic in and around the busiest Nehru Street, the Traffic police last January introduced one-side parking system.

Cars and bikes were allowed to park on the left side of road in addition to two-wheeler parking lot at the Old Prison premises.

Vehicle parking was not allowed on the right side of the road for the first half of the year.

Traders on either side of the road had expressed reservations over their business being affected if parking was permanently allowed only on one side. As per requests of the traders, the parking system is changed once every six months.

The police made new parking arrangements to facilitate vehicle parking on the left side of road. The police officials have advised the traders, shop-keepers to strictly follow the new regulations.
title: New traffic arrangements on J. N. Street for smooth traffic flow
